The optical anisotropy of 1T’-WTe 2 was characterized by ADRDM. The ADRDM measurements were conducted by measuring the normalized reflectance difference of two arbitrary orthogonal directions at normal incidence, which can provide a direct, accurate visualization of the anisotropy of low-symmetry 2D materials. In detail, when linearly polarized incident light impinges onto the 1T’-WTe 2 crystal, as expected, an obvious phase retardance (Δδ) and reflectance difference (Δ R) appears between the two optical axes.
